routes.documentation: Lists all of the available REST API operations of the Microsoft.StorSimple provider

responses.label: The collection of available provider operations.

routes.documentation: Retrieves all the managers in a subscription.

responses.label: The collection of StorSimple managers.

routes.documentation: Retrieves all the managers in a resource group.

responses.label: The collection of StorSimple managers.

routes.documentation: Deletes the manager.

responses.label: The StorSimple manager has been successfully deleted
The StorSimple manager is already in a deleted state

routes.documentation: Returns the properties of the specified manager name.

responses.label: The StorSimple manager.

routes.documentation: Updates the StorSimple Manager.

responses.label: The StorSimple manager has been successfully updated

routes.documentation: Creates or updates the manager.

responses.label: The StorSimple manager has been successfully updated
The StorSimple manager has been successfully created

routes.documentation: Retrieves all the access control records in a manager.

responses.label: The collection of access control records.

routes.documentation: Deletes the access control record.

responses.label: Accepted the request to delete the access control record.
Successfully deleted the access control record.

routes.documentation: Returns the properties of the specified access control record name.

responses.label: The access control record.

routes.documentation: Creates or Updates an access control record.

responses.label: Successfully created or updated the access control record.
Accepted the request to create or update the access control record.

routes.documentation: Retrieves all the alerts in a manager.

responses.label: The collection of alerts.

routes.documentation: Retrieves all the bandwidth setting in a manager.

responses.label: The collection of bandwidth settings.

routes.documentation: Deletes the bandwidth setting

responses.label: Accepted the request to delete the bandwidth setting.
Successfully deleted the bandwidth setting.

routes.documentation: Returns the properties of the specified bandwidth setting name.

responses.label: The bandwidth setting.

routes.documentation: Creates or updates the bandwidth setting

responses.label: Successfully created or updated the bandwidth setting.
Accepted the request to create or update the bandwidth setting.

routes.documentation: Clear the alerts.

responses.label: Successfully cleared the alerts.

routes.documentation: Lists supported cloud appliance models and supported configurations.

responses.label: The collection of cloud appliance configuration.

routes.documentation: Complete minimal setup before using the device.

responses.label: Accepted the request to configure device.
Successfully configured the device.

routes.documentation: Returns the list of devices for the specified manager.

responses.label: The collection of devices.

routes.documentation: Deletes the device.

responses.label: Accepted the request to delete the device.
Successfully deleted the device.

routes.documentation: Returns the properties of the specified device.

responses.label: The device.

routes.documentation: Patches the device.

responses.label: Successfully patched the device.

routes.documentation: Gets the alert settings of the specified device.

responses.label: The Alert settings.

routes.documentation: Creates or updates the alert settings of the specified device.

responses.label: Successfully created or updated the alert settings.
Accepted the request to create or update the alert settings.

routes.documentation: Authorizes the specified device for service data encryption key rollover.

responses.label: Successfully authorized the device for service encryption key rollover

responses.label: The backup policy.

responses.label: Successfully created or updated the backup policy.
Accepted the request to create or update the backup policy.

routes.documentation: Backup the backup policy now.

responses.label: Accepted the request to backup the backup policy.

routes.documentation: Retrieves all the backups in a device.

responses.label: The collection of backups.

routes.documentation: Deletes the backup.

responses.label: Accepted the request to delete the backup.
Successfully deleted the backup.

routes.documentation: Clones the backup element as a new volume.

responses.label: Successfully cloned the backup.
Accepted the request to clone.

routes.documentation: Restores the backup on the device.

responses.label: Successfully restored the backup.
Accepted the request to restore.

routes.documentation: Deactivates the device.

responses.label: Accepted the request to deactivate the device.
Successfully deactivated the device.

routes.documentation: Lists the hardware component groups at device-level.

responses.label: Successfully fetched hardware component groups.

routes.documentation: Changes the power state of the controller.

responses.label: Accepted the request to change power state of the controller.
Successfully changed the power state of the controller.

routes.documentation: Downloads and installs the updates on the device.

responses.label: Accepted the request to download and install updates.
Successfully installed updates.

routes.documentation: Gets all the jobs for specified device. With optional OData query parameters, a filtered set of jobs is returned.

responses.label: The collection of jobs for the specified manager and device name.

routes.documentation: Gets the details of the specified job name.

responses.label: The job.

routes.documentation: Cancels a job on the device.

responses.label: Accepted the request to cancel a deviceJob
Successfully cancelled the deviceJob

routes.documentation: Returns all failover sets for a given device and their eligibility for participating in a failover. A failover set refers to a set of volume containers that need to be failed-over as a single unit to maintain data integrity.

responses.label: Returns the list of failover sets on the given device.

routes.documentation: Gets the metrics for the specified device.

responses.label: The collection of metrics.

Accepted the request to update network settings.

routes.documentation: Returns the public encryption key of the device.

responses.label: The public key.

routes.documentation: Scans for updates on the device.

routes.documentation: Returns the Security properties of the specified device name.

responses.label: Accepted the request to failover the device.
Successfully completed failover of the device.

routes.documentation: Given a list of volume containers to be failed over from a source device, this method returns the eligibility result, as a failover target, for all devices under that resource.

responses.label: The list of target devices and their eligibility for failover.

routes.documentation: Returns the encryption settings of the manager.
